dcat:Distribution.dct:description: Decentralized finance (DeFi) data describes financial instruments not relying on intermediaries such as brokerages, exchanges, or banks by using smart contracts on a blockchain. DeFi data contain lending and borrowing funds, speculations on price movements on assets using derivatives, trading cryptocurrencies, insuring against risks, and earning interest in savings-like accounts.
dcat:Distribution.dct:title: Blockchain, cryptocurrencies and decentralized finance (DeFi)

foaf:Document.dc:creator: Ciaian, P; Rajcaniova, M; Kancs, D
foaf:Document.dct:bibliographicCitation: Ciaian, P., Rajcaniova, M. and Kancs, D., Virtual relationships: Short- and long-run evidence from BitCoin and altcoin markets , JOURNAL OF INTERNATIONAL FINANCIAL MARKETS INSTITUTIONS and MONEY, ISSN 1042-4431, 52, 2018, p. 173–195, JRC109192.
foaf:Document.dct:title: Virtual relationships: Short- and long-run evidence from BitCoin and altcoin markets

foaf:Document.dc:creator: Kancs, D; Ciaian, P; Rajcaniova, M

foaf:Document.dct:title: The Price of BitCoin: GARCH Evidence from High Frequency Data
